definition: to determine/to resolve
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Live is just a series of trying to maske up your mind.
sentences.chinese: 生活只是由一次次下決心的努力所夠成。

sentences.english: Yossi Benayoun is determined to prove to Arsène Wenger that he made the right decision to sign him this summer.
sentences.chinese: 貝納永下決心要證明溫格在今年夏天沒有看錯人。

sentences.english: On the field anomaly dissatisfaction with the determined to prove his ability.
sentences.chinese: 上田異常不滿地下決心要證明自己的能力。

sentences.english: Decide today to assign more value to the invisible things of life.
sentences.chinese: 從今天去就下決心將更高的價值讓與生活中的本性。

sentences.english: But nowadays, people have too many choices and cannot seem to make up their minds," said Etsuko Satake, principal of the Infini marriage prep school.
sentences.chinese: 但現在，人們的選擇太多，很多人似乎難以下決心。

sentences.english: The government decided to neaten the real estate market.
sentences.chinese: 國家下決心整頓房產市場。

sentences.english: They told me that you have made up your mind.
sentences.chinese: 他們告訴我說你已經下決心了。

sentences.english: Xia is painful be determined, dallied with emotive cheater to part company with this.
sentences.chinese: 阿霞痛下決心，與這個玩弄感情的騙子分手了。

sentences.english: Romans often made resolutions to ask for forgiveness from a person they had wronged.
sentences.chinese: 當時羅馬人常下決心要請曾被他們虧待的人原諒他們。

sentences.english: The Pakistani government is determined to seize the criminals as soon as possible and bring them to justice.
sentences.chinese: 巴政府下決心儘快緝拿罪犯，並將其繩之以法。

sentences.english: She resolved to make the Army her career.
sentences.chinese: 她下決心把軍人作爲她一生的職業。

sentences.english: I am resolved to try story-writing but so far have not made a start.
sentences.chinese: 我下決心試試小說寫作，不外迄今爲止還沒起頭。

sentences.english: I also resolved to educate my development organization on inspections and reviews.
sentences.chinese: 我還下決心要在檢查和評估方面訓練我的開發組織。

sentences.english: Well, resolve to change that, if that’s the case.
sentences.chinese: 如果真的有這種情況，那麼讓我們下決心改變這一點。

sentences.english: I make up my mind to study management in college.
sentences.chinese: 我下決心在大學裏攻讀管理學。

sentences.english: I am determined of firm firm earn brushstroke .
sentences.chinese: 我下決心狠狠的賺一筆。

definition: to make a firm resolution
firm/decisive
determination/resolution/determined/firm and resolute/to make up one's mind/CL:個|个[ge4]
to resume/to restart/to start afresh
to drive out/to turn back
to have had enough of/to be fed up with/to have had one's fill of
both sides suffer (idiom)/neither side wins
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to bring to a conclusion/to settle (a dispute)/to do away with (oneself)/to break off (a relationship)/resolution (of a problem)
hard to understand/incomprehensible
at the minimum/at the very least
to be determined to/to insist on
to reboot/to restart
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
means/method/way (of doing sth)/CL:條|条[tiao2],個|个[ge4]
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
